DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor TNM Stage Role Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identifies the person who recorded the pathologic AJCC staging elements and the stage group in the patient's medical record.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor TNM Stage Role
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The person who recorded the pathologic AJCC staging elements and the stage group in the patient's medical record.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredDefinition: A system of clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment. (On-line Medical Dictionary):The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event.

Concepts.definition: A system for clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Removed special characters for MDR data migration. 3.9.20 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system of clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment. (On-line Medical Dictionary)_The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._Role; the action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.: Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A problem requiring investigation.: Any distinct time period in a sequence of events.: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: A problem requiring investigation.
Any distinct time period in a sequence of events.
The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage Assignment Central Site Cancer Registry

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage Assignment Central Site Cancer Registry
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.: An allotting or an appointment to a particular person or use, or for a particular time or object.: An organizational unit or facility responsible for the coordination and/or management oversight of activities that occur at secondary or contributing organizational units engaged in the same research activities.: Cancer registries gather a wide variety of specific information on cancer patients that can be analyzed to identify health disparity trends in cancer incidence, mortality and patient survival.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
An allotting or an appointment to a particular person or use, or for a particular time or object.

An organizational unit or facility responsible for the coordination and/or management oversight of activities that occur at secondary or contributing organizational units engaged in the same research activities.
Cancer registries gather a wide variety of specific information on cancer patients that can be analyzed to identify health disparity trends in cancer incidence, mortality and patient survival.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nurse Physician Assistant Or Other Negation Physician Medical Staff

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nurse Physician Assistant Or Other Negation Physician Medical Staff
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A professional healthcare provider who has graduated from an accredited nursing program, has passed the state exam for licensure, and been registered or licensed to practice by a state authority.  Nurses are educationally prepared as functional (LPN/LVN) or professional (RN).: A person trained and qualified to provide comprehensive diagnostic, preventive, and therapeutic medical care and services to patients under the guidance of the physician. A scope of physician assistant professional activity does not include the full range of interpretation of medical findings requiring the full professional background of the licensed physician. PAs are licensed by a state authority.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.: Relating to the study or practice of medicine.: The employees of an organization; personnel who assist their superior in carrying out an assigned task.

Concepts.definition: A professional healthcare provider who has graduated from an accredited nursing program, has passed the state exam for licensure, and been registered or licensed to practice by a state authority.  Nurses are educationally prepared as functional (LPN/LVN) or professional (RN).

A person trained and qualified to provide comprehensive diagnostic, preventive, and therapeutic medical care and services to patients under the guidance of the physician. A scope of physician assistant professional activity does not include the full range of interpretation of medical findings requiring the full professional background of the licensed physician. PAs are licensed by a state authority.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.
Relating to the study or practice of medicine.
The employees of an organization; personnel who assist their superior in carrying out an assigned task.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.: A person responsible for keeping official records.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
A person responsible for keeping official records.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004: Registrar; someone responsible for keeping records.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
A person responsible for keeping official records.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold.: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.: A committee having supervisory powers.

Concepts.definition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold.
A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
A committee having supervisory powers.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (on-KOL-o-jist) A doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating cancer using chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, and biological therapy. A medical oncologist often is the main caretaker of someone who has cancer and coordinates treatment provided by other specialists.

Concepts.definition: A doctor who specializes in treating cancer. Some oncologists specialize in a particular type of cancer treatment. For example, a radiation oncologist specializes in treating cancer with radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (ray-dee-AY-shun on-KOL-o-jist) A doctor who specializes in using radiation to treat cancer.

Concepts.definition: A physician who specializes in the treatment of cancer patients, using radiation as the main modality of treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation.

Concepts.definition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pathologist is a doctor specialized in medical diagnosis based on the macroscopic and microscopic study of structural changes of tissues and organs caused by the disease.

Concepts.definition: Any physician whose career is devoted to the study of pathology.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Physician Not Otherwise Specified Or Physician Type

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Physician Not Otherwise Specified Or Physician Type

Concepts.definition: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.
Not characterized in any other way.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

A distinguishable part, a stage in a series of events or in a process of development, e.g. any of the varying aspects or stages in course of a disease; a fraction of a cycle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

Concepts.definition: A system for clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
